Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Skyphos Cup
Description: A drinking cup of skyphos style that has a wide rim and a wide and deep bowl, the width of which decreases toward the low circular foot. There are two handles close to the upper edge of the bowl, which are embossed on the outside.Skyphoi were used for serving drinks during meals. They are among the numerous styles of drinking vessels that were used for water or wine and were popular in the city of Alexandria during the Hellenistic era.
